text: Why would gson create an array with size 7 for only 5 objects in the json?
Can you post the json?
I’ve had it before where the json had empty objects in the array that I didn’t notice on first pass
Yeah, there was a stray `,` after the last object in the array so gson allocated space for it already only to notice later there won’t be another object. Wonder if gson should be more robust there.

well, gson can’t really know if this was intended or not … json array can contain anything and _anything_ is _nothing_ as well and that could have some implications for someone … overall, trying to remove something without the user's consent is not very defensive and is a source of future bugs
Yeah that’s what I had, annoying but as <@U2EHF260Z> said, can’t really expect gson to know if it’s intended or not

Hi guys, I am facing a problem in an app I am making, I am using a `Toolbar`on top of my layout, and the `Toolbar` has a `TextView` inside it,  so that I can align the title in the center of the app.
The theme that I am using for this Activity is `@style/Theme.AppCompat.Light.NoActionBar`
As I change that to `@style/Theme.AppCompat.NoActionBar` , I am able to see the back button (Up Action) on the toolbar
I mean the Back button is black and I am only able to see it when I either set the colour of the `Toolbar` to Dark or use the Dark theme
How can I change the colour of the BackButton ?
Can you post that as a snippet please?
I tried creating a custom style in Values > styles.xml and called it `ToolbarTheme` (please see the second attached snippet)
Instead of just pasting it into chat

text: So overall, I just need a way to change the Theme of ONLY my `Toolbar` so that it automatically shows a Light colored Up button. Or,  a way to change the color of the Up button to white manually.
Thanks !! any help will be appreciated.
<@U1HLABD1S> did you find a way to start it with a specific color in the end? it seems like a bug that the color passed through TaskDescription isn’t working :thinking_face:
<@U0548MM6B> It is working, but the color is applied _after_ I'm opening the task switcher.

I have no solution for that now. The only possible solution would be to hand over an argument to the activity service, so that it can already define the color before the activity is launched (similar to what is done with label and icon from the manifest file).
But that launch parameter does not exist (yet)
Maybe worth a feature request in the issue tracker
it’s a pretty rare usecase, not sure if they’ll even notice it :confused:
It's very rare, yes.
But I bashed around to try it, and was able to hit it :slightly_smiling_face:

Does anyone has experience in Twiiter SDK , I want to get list of all tweet Ids , I dont want to show a default UserTimeline
any help
<@U0LFEJ1ST> I do. what are you trying to retrieve exactly?
<@U09T8SFG8> I just want plain simple list of tweet ids
as per the username which has signed in
I am not getting you, list of tweets that the user has made?
yeah
but that's the timeline
as per their documentation “current” we can use this : ```UserTimeline userTimeline = new UserTimeline.Builder().screenName("fabric").build(); ```

and pass this into ``` final TweetTimelineListAdapter adapter = new TweetTimelineListAdapter.Builder(this)
            .setTimeline(userTimeline)
            .build(); ```
so you want to customize the look of it
but I dont want to use there UI to show timeline, I want to make my custom recycler view to populate the tweet text
Guys, any help with my problem ? Please
<@U0LFEJ1ST> you need to use the TwitterApiClient in that case with the user timeline request
you will get a (very) basic representation of tweets
I suggest you wrap each tweet to your own data structure
then you can use that list with your own adapter
you will also probably need to implement pagination
pagination in twitter works with the ids, to request a new page you say the max id you want
<@U09T8SFG8> I just want 5 - 10 tweets
no need of pagination
then set the count to 10 in your request
this will give you the last 10 tweets
```        new TwitterApiClient().getStatusesService().userTimeline(null,gusername,5,null,null,null,null,null,null); ```
something like this ?
<@U09T8SFG8>  where is the callback ?

``` @GET("/1.1/statuses/user_timeline.json?" +
            "tweet_mode=extended&include_cards=true&cards_platform=TwitterKit-13")
    Call<List<Tweet>> userTimeline(<@U1ST4SMTR>("user_id") Long userId,
                                   <@U1ST4SMTR>("screen_name") String screenName,
                                   <@U1ST4SMTR>("count") Integer count,
                                   <@U1ST4SMTR>("since_id") Long sinceId,
                                   <@U1ST4SMTR>("max_id") Long maxId,
                                   <@U1ST4SMTR>("trim_user") Boolean trimUser,
                                   <@U1ST4SMTR>("exclude_replies") Boolean excludeReplies,
                                   <@U1ST4SMTR>("contributor_details") Boolean contributeDetails,
                                   <@U1ST4SMTR>("include_rts") Boolean includeRetweets); ```
usrtimeline does not take any callback now, this is what bugging me :face_with_head_bandage:
isn't the last parameter the callback?
no not in there update , iguess
<@U09T8SFG8> few months back I used than it used to be there
looks like it's just a retrofit call <https://square.github.io/retrofit/2.x/retrofit/retrofit2/Call.html>
you can just `execute()` it
ok , Thanks <@U09T8SFG8>
<@U09T8SFG8> I was using retrofit 1.8 , the new Retrofit2 is completely different , and they do not handle background service , whats the alternate ? do we have to make our own async now ?
you can either migrate to Retrofit2 or use an older twitter sdk that uses retrofit 1.x
<@U0LFEJ1ST> it handles background service in Retrofit2
use .enqueue(CallbackGoesHere)
<@U0548MM6B>  ok , so I should use it with function.enque(Callback)
<@U0548MM6B>  aah, Got it , Thanks guys , I guess its time to migrate :partyparrot:

Is there any way to save a bitmap to a jpg file without compressing it?
jpg, by definition, is a compression format
<@U16GF1B0F> right, but is there no way for one to save a bitmap as it is into a jpg image?
proper `Bitmap` objects are decompressed
Ugh, just spent the last weeks learning react, and how horrible JS is, now I just got a go ahead to make a sizable react-native app :unamused:
creating a `Bitmap` from jpeg data decompresses the data, so going from `Bitmap` back to jpg requires compression
Just do it native and don’t tell anyone  :stuck_out_tongue:
if `Bitmap`s were compressed already, then omg we’d have so many fewer OutOfMemoryExceptions

it's a rabbit hole, you don't want camera in your app. If it's all about one shot use case, go for the system camera. One possible cause of your bitmap issue might be large bitmap. Don't try to load it into ImageView without scaling down: <https://developer.android.com/training/displaying-bitmaps/load-bitmap.html>

attachments.title: Loading Large Bitmaps Efficiently | Android Developers
attachments.text: Images come in all shapes and sizes. In many cases they are larger than required for a typical application user interface (UI). For example, the system Gallery application displays photos taken using your Android devices&#39;s camera which are typically…
